alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 20 at 9:40PM PDT until March 22 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO 6 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Snowfall of 3 to 10 inches expected between 4000-5000 ft, 1 to 2 feet between 5000-6000 ft, 2 to 5 ft between 6000-700 ft, and 5+ ft above 7000 ft. Winds gusting as high as 85 mph. * WHERE...San Bernardino County Mountains. * WHEN...From 6 AM Tuesday to 6 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible due to near zero visibility in heavy falling and blowing snow, and fog. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow level will be around 5500 feet early Tuesday, then rise to 6000-6500 feet late Tuesday morning. The snow level will then fall Tuesday evening and overnight to around 4000 feet by early Wednesday morning. The snow level will then fluctuate around 4500 feet for Wednesday afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
